purpleculture_pinyin:
xiàn
to offer; to present; to dedicate; to donate; to show; to put on display; worthy person (old)
предлагать; представлять; посвящать; пожертвовать; показывать; выставить на обозрение; достойный человек (старый)

(Simplified: 献)
Pictophonetic: 鬳 indicates the sound; 犬 (dog) conveys the meaning.

獻策 [ xiàn cè ]: to offer advice; to make a suggestion

heisig_chinese_memo: The witch keeps a tiger, a chihuahua, and a cauldron for (what she believes is) donateing to the society by helping people puts spells on others.
Ru_trainchinese: xiàn: (глаг) преподносить, отдавать, посвящать; показывать, демонстрировать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the dog (犬) in the cauldron (鬳) is an offering
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A South Korean street vendor is offering chihuahua snacks, but welcomes everyone to donate.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The sacrifices for ceremonies were not only meat (肉, rou, flesh). Among the elements of the symbol “” (獻, 献, xian=hsien, offer, dedicate), is the head of a tiger roaring (虎, hu, tiger). Why is the head of a tiger on top of the ceremonial cauldron? And what about the animal next to it which is similar to the dog? In ancient China, the head of a prisoner of war or a precious animal might also be offered to the king or the gods. One of the discoveries from ancient sites shows a human head still inside a bronze cauldron. The character shows a head of precious animals such as a tiger, and maybe even a dog was used as sacrifice.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle's meaning is unknown. Bronze inscription means to offer, Qiang Bogui: "to offer silk." "Zhou Li. Heaven official. "Jade Mansion": "The King of the King's Offering of Gold and Jade", Zheng Xuan's note: "The ancients give things to people, and the respected is called donation, and the passage is called "giving." It was said that Duoyou offered the prisoners of war to the public. "poetry. Lu Song. "Pan Shui": "Jiao Jiao Hu Chen, in Pan." Zheng Xuan Jian: "Fu, the left ear of the person who is qualified." It means a vigorous general who puts the left ear of the prisoner of war next to Pan Shui. It is also pronounced "甗", a kind of cooking utensils. Bozhen 甗: "Bai (Bo) Zhenzha (as) Travel Xian (甗)", which means that Bozhen made the 甗 for accompanying. Also used as a name. The word " ding " in the Warring States period may be changed to "鬲".

"Shuowen": "Xian, the name of the ancestral temple dog soup, and the fat dog will give it. From the dog, the sound of the dog.
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jinwen from "鬳" from " dog ", "鬳" and " dog " are both sound symbols. "鬳" is the original text of "甗", it is a vessel for holding food, used for sacrifices, and it means to use 甗 to offer food. The original meaning is to offer.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文用義不詳。金文表示進獻，羌伯簋：「獻帛」。《周禮．天官．玉府》：「凡王之獻金玉」，鄭玄注：「古者致物於人，尊之則曰獻，通行曰饋。」多友鼎：「多友迺獻俘、聝、訊于公」，意謂多友於是進獻戰俘給公。《詩．魯頌．泮水》：「矯矯虎臣，在泮獻馘。」鄭玄箋：「馘，所格者之左耳。」意謂矯健的武將，在泮水旁邊進獻戰俘的左耳。又讀作「甗」，一種炊器，伯真甗：「白(伯)真乍(作)旅獻(甗)」，表示伯真製造隨行用的甗。又用作人名。戰國文字「鼎」旁或訛變為「鬲」。

　　《說文》：「獻，宗廟犬名羹獻，犬肥者以獻之。从犬，鬳聲。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「鬳」從「犬」，「鬳」、「犬」皆是聲符。「鬳」是「甗」的初文，是盛食物的器皿，用來祭祀，表示用甗進獻食物之意。本義是進獻。

獻字的基本解释

獻
xiàn
见“献”。

獻字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiàn］
［《廣韻》許建切，去願，曉。］
“献1”的繁体字。
(1)祭宗庙所用之犬。引申指献祭。
(2)泛指祭品。
(3)进酒。
(4)指行酒一次。
(5)奉献。进贡。指藩属奉献礼物。
(6)奉献。把东西奉送给尊者或敬重的人。
(7)奉献。貢献力量，表陈心意、意见等。
(8)指进献的东西。
(9)进入，进到。参见“獻歲”、“獻春”。
(10)呈现，现出。
(11)表现。参见“獻殷勤”、“獻技”。
(12)贤者。
(13)指有历史价值的图书、文物等。
(14)姓。战国秦有献则。参阅汉应劭《风俗通·姓氏》。
[②]［suō］
［《廣韻》素何切，平歌，心。］
“献2”的繁体字。
(1)古代一种滤酒方法。
(2)雕刻。参见“獻2豆”。
(3)通“犠”。古代酒器名。参见“獻2尊”。
[③]［xī］
［《集韻》虚宜切，平支，曉。］
同“桸1”。“献3”的繁体字。
勺子；勺形之物。
[④]［yí］
［《集韻》魚覊切，平支，疑

獻字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【犬字部】　獻； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页721第09
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?許建切，音憲。【說文】宗廟犬名羹獻，犬肥者以獻之。从犬，鬳聲。【禮·曲禮】犬曰羹獻。　又【廣韻】進也。【爾雅·釋詁】享獻也。【疏】致物於尊者曰獻。【周禮·天官·小宰】膳獻。【註】膳獻，禽羞俶獻也。又【膳夫】王燕飮酒，則爲獻主。　又【書·益稷】萬邦黎獻。【傳】獻，賢也。【論語】文獻不足故也。　又【爾雅·釋言】獻，聖也。【諡法】聰明叡哲曰獻。知質有聖曰獻。　又【爾雅·釋天】太歲在亥曰大淵獻。　又姓。【風俗通】秦大夫獻則。　又【集韻】桑何切，音娑。酒尊名，飾以翡翠，鄭司農說。本作犧，或作戲。詳牛部犧字註。　又【禮·明堂位】周獻豆。【註】獻，疏刻之。【疏】正義曰：獻，音娑。娑是希疏之義，故爲疏刻之。【釋文】素何反。　又【集韻】魚羈切，音宜。儀也。【周禮·春官·司尊彝】鬱齊獻酌。【註】鄭司農云：獻，讀爲儀。儀酌有威儀多也。　又【正韻】虛宜切，音羲。【前漢·王莽傳】建華蓋，立斗獻。【註】師古曰：獻音犧，謂斗魁及杓末如勺之形也

獻字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
獻字的起名意思

暂无。

offer
Basic explanation of words
offer
xiàn
See "xian".
offer
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiàn］
["Guang Yun" Xu Jianqie, go to wish, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters of "Xian 1 ".
(1) The dog used by the ancestral temple. The extension refers to sacrifice.
(2) Refers to offerings in general.
(3) Drinking.
(4) Refers to drinking wine once.
(5) Dedication. Tribute. Refers to vassal dedication gifts.
(6) Dedication. Give things to the venerable or respected person.
(7) Dedication. Contribute, express your wishes, opinions, etc.
(8) Refers to what is offered.
(9) Enter, enter. See "Xian Sui", "Xian Chun".
(10) Present, appear.
(11) Performance. See "Giving Diligence", "Giving Skills".
(12) The sage.
(13) Refers to books and cultural relics of historical value.
(14) Last name. Warring States Qin Youxian Ze. See Han Ying Shao's "Fun Su Tong · Surname".
[②] [suō]
["Guangyun" is so cut, flat song, heart. ]
"Xian 2" in traditional characters.
(1) An ancient method of filtering wine.
(2) Carving. See "Offering 2 Beans".
(3) Through "Y". Names of ancient wine vessels. See "Offering 2 statues".
[③] [xī]
["Jiyun" is empty and suitable for cutting, flat branch, and dawn. ]
Same as "桸1". "Xian 3" in traditional characters.
Spoon; something in the shape of a spoon.
[④]［yí］
["Jiyun" fish cut, flat branch, doubt
offer

Also 【Sinfu】Wang Yanshoujiu is the consecrated master.　[Book·Yiji] Wanbang Lixian. [Biography] Dedication, Xian Ye. There is a holy saying for knowledge and quality.　[Erya·Shitian] Tai Sui is dedicated to Dayuan in Haiyue.　Another last name. Detailed note on the word sacrifice of the cow department.　[Li Mingtang] Zhou Xiandou. [Note] Dedicated, sparsely carved. [Shu] Zhengyi said: Xian, Yin Suo. Sorry is the meaning of sparse, so it is sparsely carved. 【Explanation】So what is the opposite.　[Jiyun] The fish is cut, the sound is suitable. There are many prestige and more gimmicks.　[Zheng Yun] It's appropriate to cut, and the sound is Xi. [Previous Han·Wang Mang Biography] Jianhua Gai, stand up fighting.
